data.name: ERRMSG_INTERNAL_PROCESSING_ERROR_002
data.value: INTERNAL PROCESSING ERROR 002: A parameter type information element format is incorrect; the field count differs from the expected field count.{3} Expected field count = {0}{3} Actual field count = {1}{3} Actual detail record = {2}{3}
data.comment: Under normal conditions, this message is never shown, because this error should never happen in a correctly coded program, unless the program file is corrupted.

data.name: ERRMSG_INTERNAL_PROCESSING_ERROR_004
data.value: INTERNAL PROCESSING ERROR 004: A parameter type information element name is incorrect; the {0} value is undefined and unsupported.{1}
data.comment: Under normal conditions, this message is never shown, because this error should never happen in a correctly coded program, unless the program file is corrupted.

data.name: ERRMSG_INTERNAL_PROCESSING_ERROR_005
data.value: INTERNAL PROCESSING ERROR 005: Type information for the {0} parameter cannot be found in the embedded {1} resource.{2}
data.comment: Under normal conditions, this message is never shown, because this error should never happen in a correctly coded program, unless the program file is corrupted.

data.name: ERRMSG_INVALID_PARAMETER_TYPE
data.comment: The implementation of abstract method IsValueValid in a class derived from OperatingParameterBase was called when the private _enmParameterType member of the concrete instance had a value that cannot be converted to the type specified to the definition of the concrete instance. Since constructors of derived classes take generics, the type is unknown at design time.

data.name: ERRMSG_UNDEFINED_ARGNAME
data.comment: Instance method GetParameterByName on an OperatingParametersCollection object formats the error message to report being called with an invalid (undefined) argument name.

data.name: MESSAGE_APPSETTINGS_FOOTER
data.comment: The ListAllAppSettings method of the main Program class formats the heading of a report about the application's settings from this template.

data.name: MESSAGE_APPSETTINGS_HEADER
data.comment: The ListAllAppSettings method of the main Program class formats a summary of the application setting from this template.

data.name: MESSAGE_APPSETTING_VALUE
data.comment: The ListAllAppSettings method of the main Program class formats details about each application setting from this template.

data.name: MESSAGE_DEFALUT_PER_APP_SETTINGS
data.comment: From this template, a message is constructed to report the default value for this property that is stored in the application settings collection.

data.name: MESSAGE_DEFINED_APPSETTINGS
data.comment: The main routine formats a report about one of the application settings from this template.

data.name: MESSAGE_INVALID_PARAMETER_TYPE_VALUE
data.value: {0}{4} Column Name = {1}{4} Column Index = {2}{4} Whole Record = {3}{4}
data.comment: The ParameterTypeInfo constructor formats an exception report from this template when it encounters an unexpected parameter type in the embedded resource stream.

data.name: MESSAGE_NO_DEFAULT_IN_APP_SETTINGS
data.value: The settings property '{0}' was not found.
data.comment: From this template, the text of the expected Message property of the SettingsPropertyNotFoundException that is thrown when there is no like-named property in the Settings collection is constructed by calling string.Format with this template and the expected property name.

data.name: MESSAGE_NO_DEFAULT_VALUE
data.value: {1}There is no default value in the application settings for the '{0}' parameter.{1}
data.comment: From this template, a message is constructed to report that no default value for this property exists in the application settings collection.

data.name: MESSAGE_PARAMETER_NAME
data.comment: The main routine formats a message that lists the name of a parameter from this template.

data.name: MESSAGE_RESOURCE_NAMES_DETAIL
data.comment: A subroutine in the main program class formats a report detailfrom this template.

data.name: MESSAGE_RESOURCE_NAMES_FOOTER
data.comment: A subroutine in the main program class formats a report footer from this template.

data.name: MESSAGE_RESOURCE_NAMES_HEADER
data.comment: A subroutine in the main program class formats a report header from this template.

data.name: MESSAGE_UNEXPECTED_SETTINGS_TYPE
data.value: The type of Application Settings property type mismatch:{4} Settings property name = {0}{4} Settings property type = {1}{4} Expected settings type = {2}{4} Settings property value = {3}{4}
data.comment: From this template, an InvalidCastException exception message is constructed to report that the type of a property in the Application Settings collection differs from the type specified for the parameter in the application code.

data.name: MSG_PARAMETER_LIST_FOOTER
data.comment: The main routine generates a report footer from this template.

data.name: MSG_PARAMETER_LIST_HEADER
data.comment: The main routine generates a report heading from this template.

data.name: OPERATING_PARAMETER_TOSTRING
data.comment: The custom ToString implementation in the OperatingParameterBase class and its deriviatives use this string to render their output.

data.name: PARAMETER_DISPLAY_NAME_TEMPLATE
data.comment: This string is fed into the OperatingParametersCollection for use as the template from which to construct the names of companion strings to use as display names for the parameters.

data.name: PARAM_DISPLAY_NAME_OperatingParameter1
data.comment: Use this string as the display name for the parameter that has the internal name OperatingParameter1.

data.name: PARAM_DISPLAY_NAME_OperatingParameter3
data.comment: Use this string as the display name for the parameter that has the internal name OperatingParameter3.

data.name: RENDERED_STRING_IS_EMPTY
data.comment: Static method RenderStringValue returns this string to denote that the input string is the empty string.

data.name: RENDERED_STRING_IS_NULL
data.comment: Static method RenderStringValue returns this string to denote that the input string is a null reference.
